pages.title: ⤝ Six of Swords ⤝
pages.text: Spirit of Earned Success$(br)   ☿ Mercury in ♒ Aquarius

A small boat carries a child bundled in a robe to the further shore.$(br)  The course is smooth, and seeing that the freight is light, it can be said the journey will require but light work.$(br)  A vision of six swords, poised in the air like a fence, escorts the small passenger along.$(br)  The swords here may represent memories, relationships, habits, behaviours, thought patterns

and beliefs that are no longer serving us.$(br)  We need to gaze through them, ahead to our future, and decide what we need to take with us and what we can leave behind.$(br)  This card represents a state of transition, leaving behind what was familiar and moving towards the unknown.$(br)  With mental clarity and a renewed acceptance of change, new discoveries are in set course.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Intellect, great ideas, seeing how everything fits together. Progress, new perspectives.$(br)  May mean separating your ideas from your emotions.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Confession, declaration. Becoming emotional.$(br)  Possibly seeing the flaws or difficulties in some grand idea.
